name: Embassy Suites Boston Logan Airport

reviews.text: First, the staff of the hotel was very friendly. The hotel itself is dated and located next to two airport rental car wash facilities. The furniture in our suite was stained, old and frayed. The sofa bed was so old and tired that I had to request a rollaway bed for one of my kids. My biggest problem was a safety concern. For the first time in my life, I fell in a bathtub. As I fell,I was able to grab the shower curtain and a safety bar to break my fall. I still ended up with a very bruised thigh. I am a 45 year old male in good health. One my teenagers also reported to me that she slipped and nearly fell. If this had happened to an elderly person, it could have had very serious consequences. I reported the incident to the front desk manager. She apologized and filled out an incident report. Later that day, the hotel staff placed a safety mat in the tub. This could not have been the first time an incident like this happened at this hotel. I am a fairly regular business and casual traveler and try to stay at Embassy Suites hotels. This hotel fell short of my expectations for Embassy Suites hotels.
reviews.title: Not a great stay

reviews.text: The bane of the business traveler is the airport hotel. Often they know they have you in box if you have to stay there and knowing that too many of them slip in quality and service becuase they know you need a room. This Embassy Suites was up to the standards of a normal business embassy suites, and really IMHO a little above that.
reviews.title: Great for when you have to be overnight at an airport.

reviews.text: I wanted to take a Day in Boston with family before heading on vacation the next morning in London. ES is a great place as you have the morning breakfast and evening reception.
reviews.title: The pro's outweigh the con's, I guess

reviews.text: I like that it's close to the T, which was fun as we don't have trains where I live.
reviews.title: No Liquor, But still a great Hotel

reviews.text: I slept on the hide a bed to allow my family the more comfortable beds. I'm not going to review the hide a bed lol. But the sheets and room was clean. We didn't have any issues with noise as some others have posted in reviews, and generally it was a pretty solid place to lay over.
reviews.title: Walls are too thin!

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel on several occassions, for personal travel. It's very close to the airport and has always been less expensive than other hotels in the area. We always go out at night in the city and have had no trouble getting the hotel's free shuttel to take us to the metro and going in from there.
reviews.title: Great deal!

reviews.text: We love Embassy Suites b/c their room rates include a free, very generous buffet breakfast and a nightly manager's reception. We were disappointed when we discovered that this hotel doesn't offer alcohol at its nightly reception - we were told that it is prohibited by a state law. Other than that, this hotel lives up to our expectations for Embassy Suites... comfortable, spacious rooms (1 room w/ sofa bed + separate bedroom), very clean, for an affordable rate that includes a great breakfast.
reviews.title: Just What We Needed
Service is sub-par
reviews.text: We flew into Boston Logan Airport on a Friday night with no reservation, called the Embassy Suites and were picked up within minutes. The rate was $139 for a King Suite which included a separate living area and pull out sofa. The hotel was clean and quiet. I never heard a plane. It was located in the midst of rental car lots, but that was fine... we wanted to rent one for a day. The buffet breakfast was included each morning with the option to special order from the chef. So many choices! From 5:30-7:30 p.m. daily there were snacks and drinks... also included. Veggies, chips and salsa, cheese and crackers, brownie bites. The Airport T Station was a little farther than expected... a good 7 minute walk... but the weather was perfect during our stay so it was fine. There's also a computer room off the lobby with free internet access and printers. Just beware... there's no place to eat around here except the lobby restaurant. We tried it Friday night and it was good... about $8.85 for a heaping burger and fries. Next time we'll stay at least one or two nights in downtown Boston. All the hotels we saw downtown were close to T stations so we could have gotten right back to the airport, but this hotel was definitely a good find for a first visit and we would stay again. Note: The hotel front desk could have been a little nicer. Everyone else was wonderful! They whisked us away to the airport by ourselves when we were ready.

reviews.title: We'll be back as soon as we can !
reviews.text: I work with a company planning conferences and this is by far one of the worst Hilton Properties I've dealt with for an event. While this might be a great hotel for a family vacation... it is surely not the "attendee-pleasing" venue I was assured it would be.

reviews.title: Really disappointed with this hotel...
reviews.text: My guests complained of un-helpful hotel staff and extremely slow airport shuttles to the hotel. On top of that... I was told that I could leave packages at the front desk and that they had daily FedEx pickup. The packages were still at the hotel almost a week later.

Good choice for either transient or staying in Boston. The hotel is a 5 minute ride from the airport terminal by the hotel's van. From the hotel to the MTA station is about a 5 minute walk around the soccer field just outside. It is then two stops to downtown Boston. It is about a 10 minute cab ride to the cruise ship piers. The area is quiet, despite the airport traffic. The hotel was clean and comfortable, quite a trick as it was packed with summer travelers. Our room was a suite with the usual amenities: flat screen TVs in each room, frig, microwave, etc. The morning buffet was extensive but average. Hotel employees seemed genuinely interested in their jobs. We received a very good internet rate for the room. All in all, hard to beat.
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.text: the hotel is close to the airport and 3 minutes walk from the metro. The hotel offers complimentary: breakfast, shuttle to the airport, wifi in the room. All-suite, there is therefore the place. Room and hotel very clean. Full breakfast with omelets made ​​to order. No special charme.
reviews.title: close to the airport and the metro, free shuttle

reviews.text: This is a very nice Embassy Suites with a great location if you're using the airport, rental cars and/or the train. They have a great concierge to help you find something fun to do. The beds are more comfortable than most hotels and the rooms are very nice. Nice bar and free breakfast, what's not to like?!
reviews.title: Extremely convenient
Overall Good Experience
reviews.text: My family stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 nights for our family vacation. While this is an airport hotel, it's relatively quiet. Beds were comfortable, room clean and staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, with cook to order omelets and eggs, waffles, pancakes and a large variety of other breakfast items.

reviews.title: Remarkably Quiet
reviews.text: Downside - an elevator went out of service during our stay which led to long wait times to get to our room. The manager's reception was disappointing. All 5 nights offered the same choices - crackers, cheese, vegetables, ranch dip, chips and salsa. Considering they cannot offer alcoholic beverages, you would think they could offer a better variety of options each evening. The last 2 nights were free - on our hilton points and apparently housecleaning took those days off. Coffee, creamers, etc. did not get refreshed in our room, and cleaning consisted of making up the beds.

After a week in my old home town for business, I decided to stay at Logan the night before my 6 AM flight home. I returned my rental car and the car company's shuttle dropped me right off at the hotel (as opposed to leaving at the terminal to call the hotel's shuttle).
reviews.title: Great airport hotel

likes.liked: — Cleanliness, proximity to the airport, friendly staff

reviews.text: Check in was quick and easy...there was a flight crew checking in as well and the three people behind the desk took care of us all within a few minutes.
reviews.title: Fantastic Rooms, Service a bit slow

likes.disliked: — Poor Internet Access, slow restaurant service

reviews.text: The room was a big surprise. I used to stay in Embassy Suites hotels for work and this one is nothing like the ones I remember. Inside, it's completely new. The rooms are large and bright with good kitchettes and HUGE bathrooms. The bathroom had a door into the living room and a door into the bedroom...nice touch. There was enough furniture to allow a few people to lounge around and watchin TV, but not enough to crowd the room at all. The walls were solid and I never heard a a neighbor or a plane (any business traveler who has stayed at an airport hotel knows how important this is!).
reviews.title: Great price for a city hotel

reviews.text: I was only in this hotel for about seven hours, but they were good ones. When I checked out at 4 AM, the guy working the front desk was cheerful and upbeat. There was a security guard there as well and the shuttle driver was equally chipper.
reviews.title: Beware of bait and switch. Horrible restaurant

likes.liked: — The rooms were nice. Comfortable beds.
likes.disliked: — restaurant is horrible. Staff are surly, be sure you know what you're gettting for the rate.

reviews.text: It was a quick stay, but one I'd say tops those I've had at Embassy Suites hotels.
reviews.title: Check your credit card statement after staying here!

reviews.text: If you need to be close to the airport for an early start, especially if you have young children, then this hotel is for you, They run a free and frequent shuttle bus to the terminals and the nearest 'T'. Very quiet two room suites with lots of space. friendly staff and a buffet breakfast is included.
reviews.title: A quiet hotel with excellent suites a stone's throw from the airport
Very Satisfied
reviews.text: We recently returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel. This is not a luxury hotel and there were a couple of things that needed updating (shabby linens) but overall we were extremely satisfied with our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was large, comfortable and very quiet, in spite of proximity to the airport. Housekeeping was excellent and the included breakfast was certainly worth getting up for. My son and I loved the made to order pancakes (blueberry, raspberry, chocolate chip or strawberry).
reviews.title: Good value, comfortable, convenient

likes.disliked: — Phone calls were answered by unhelpful staff

reviews.text: The walk to the nearest T station was pleasant and made the short trip into Boston a breeze. We really enjoyed coming back (home) after a busy day in Boston and the contrasting quiet was very nice. Staff was very friendly and shuttles to the airport or T station were always available. What's not to like? We would stay there again in a hearbeat.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the stay! Very nice, helpful staff

likes.disliked: — Not very convenient--far from city attractions

reviews.title: Loved it
reviews.text: Decided to get a hotel for the final night of our vacation after spending the previous nights at a friends apartment. Tried Priceline for downtown/copley but was unable to get anything for under $200 on only a few days notice. Saw the Embassy had vacancy at a nice AAA rate and took it.

reviews.title: Just the ticket for us
reviews.text: My wife and I spent a long weekdend in Boston. June 29th- July 2nd. I did not want to pay center city prices. Since we are avid users of the T, we wanted to be close to a T stop. The made to order included breakfast and the nightly manager's reception was a definite plus. We are Hilton honors members and usuallly gravitate to Embassy Suites. As pointed out by other reviewers there are some differences at this Embassy Suites. You do not have the large atrium with all of the rooms coming off of it. Your room opens onto a hall instead. This eliminates one of my pet peeves found in most Embassy Suites. That is the 3 AM door slam which tends to reverberate throughout the cavernous atrium. If you are sleeping on the pullout, this is something you can't miss. The rooms are a little smaller, but not to the extent that it causes a problem. They have at least 4 shuttle busses. (I counted) They are very close to the airport. Our view overlooked the Dollar rent a car lot with the airport in the backround. If you have kids who love planes, you can look out the windows and watch the planes take off. You also overlook the new astroturffed ball fields. Bring your soccer ball and enjoy. The new T station is a very short walk from the hotel. You simply come out the main entrance, cross the street, walk around the fields to the left, and run right into the T station. If you are in Boston for a few days and plan to use the T for your travels, get the 7 day link pass for only 12 dollars. The T is an experience in itself. Lots of people watching and always a station convenient to your destination. Boston is a walking city, and the T helps you to do that. The hotel has a business center with computers for your use. There is a small gym with a couple of treadmills and a few other machines. The pool was mainly frequented by children nonstop. There was supposed to be adult supervision, but I rarely saw any. So if you are an adult looking for a little relaxation in the hot tub, this is not the place for it. I don't fault the hotel for this situation though. Just a product of the me generation. To sum it up, I would use this hotel again in a heartbeat when visiting Boston. P.S. There is a kiosk located by the front desk for you to print out your boarding passes. (very convenient indeed)

I've been a Hilton Diamond member for 7 years and spend 4 days a week in Hilton properties for business. I use the points each year for hotel stays on vacation with the family and typically stay at Embassy Suites....this is by far the worst Hilton location I have ever stayed at; missed wake up calls, no alarm clocks in the room, beds not made, 1 towel in room, no soap, no utensils at breakfast buffet, 45 minutes to get valet service and a staff that didn't care one way or the other about any of the above. The location wasn't the best, but the subway station was only a 5 minute walk...that is about the only positive thing I can say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Worst Embassy Suites in the US
Nice little get away
reviews.text: We stayed at the Embassy Suites in May of 2007, we weren't thrilled that it was so close to the airport, but it never became a problem, no airplane noise what-so-ever. It was great to start every day with a made to order breakfast, fresh fruit and good strong coffee. Each day one of the staff would stop by our table to see how things were going. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel has shuttles to and from the airport and to the T (Boston's subway which is REALLY easy to figure out) (If you are doing are taking the T a lot buy a $15.00 pass good for a few days it will save you A LOT of money in the long run) If you don't want to take the shuttle to the T, just walk the 2 1/2 blocks through the park and you will be at the T in 5-10 minutes. The rooms are a little small compared to other Embassy Suites, but still very nice and comfy. The only problem we encountered was when my mom put popcorn in the microwave and hit the popcorn button, the popcorn started smoking and set off the alarms, but it was reassuring the know that the alarms worked and that you could NEVER sleep through them. We enjoyed the happy hour and snacks, by the end of the week, when the bartender saw us coming he would have our bloody mary's and beer sitting at a table, sounds like a scene from Cheers doesn't it? It was great!!!!
Went to a business conference at the BCEC (Boston Convention center) in June 2007. I was with my daughter who is 11.
reviews.title: Great for all, great deal and location!!

likes.liked: — close to all but far enough to be cheaper, and SPACE in room
likes.disliked: — cold pool and cant park your car easily or cheaply

reviews.text: I got a GREAT rate using my AAA membership via the Embassy Suites website. About 40 to 50% less than the hotels attached to the center (Seaport and the Westin).
reviews.title: Very good airport hotel, don't expect nice Embassy touches

likes.disliked: — Not enough staff at breakfast (slow line). High prices in restaurant for middling quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for a next day flight and it was a good choice.
reviews.title: Nice hotel near the airport at a great price
Good base for a family visiting Boston
reviews.text: We had a rented car and the drop off was 50 meters from the hotel, the check-in was fast and the staff was very helpful.
The rooms are very large, clean and modern, the bathroom is also large and we didn't have any problem with pressure or heat.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: We arrived late so we ordered the dinner through room service, the price was a bit high but the food was very good.
reviews.title: Nice but lacking in customer service.

reviews.text: The only downside it's the location: if you have to catch a flight it's perfect because there's even a free shuttle but if you plan to visit the city it's a bit too far from downtown Boston.
reviews.title: Mediocrity at its average

reviews.text: Spent a night here before driving up to Maine to check into our beach house for the week - We flew in early enough to drop off our bags and then take the shuttle to the T-station and head into downtown Boston for the day. Very easy to do and we were in the heart of Boston before we knew it! I will say the surrounding area to the hotel is not pretty. Your basically on the backside of the rental car lots on one side and an interesting neighborhood on the other.. At the recommendation of the very nice bartendar - we walked through the neighborhood to a great little family restaurant - will write a review on that too!
reviews.title: I'd stay here again

reviews.text: Room was very clean & spacious - although I have to say regarding the furniture in the 'suite-side' of the room - it is the most uncomfortable furniture I have ever sat on in my life - might as well of been a couple of boards nailed together..
reviews.title: Good hotel and convenient for getting into Boston

reviews.text: Breakfast was very good - cooked to order omlets - plenty of other choices - good coffee (hey, I got my priorities!)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Shuttle drivers were pretty helpful and for the most part very nice - one or two really must not like their jobs very much but overall was very pleased with this service.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.text: If I was staying in Boston the entire time, I am not sure this is the place I would choose to stay but for my purpose, it was great!
reviews.title: Affordable family vacation

reviews.text: My husband and I stay at an Embassy wherever we go - primarily because of the separate room for my stepdaughter but also because it's a great chain! However, we've stayed in better ones.
reviews.title: Overall, nice hotel!
We couldn't have chosen a better hotel!
reviews.text: There isn't much of a view, at least not where our room was. We were overlooking the Hertz rent-a-car which is right across the street, as well as Dollar rent-a-car (which did come in handy when we took a day trip to Salem and one to Cape Cod). It is a very quick ride via courtesy shuttle from the airport and to and from the T (subway system). It runs every 15 mins during the normal hours and will come within 10 mins when you call them (24 hours a day).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our first ever visit to the USA. We had a three week itinerary covering a wide area and decided it would be best to overnight at this hotel prior to our flights home next day.
reviews.title: functional and convenient location...

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently sited near to Logan airport and hire car drop off points. Both are only a walk away though the hotel does operate a convenient complimentary shuttle service to both the airport and the nearby T line subway stations.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of rooms and proximity to the airport

reviews.text: The good thing about staying in corporate chain type hotels is that you know what you are getting as they are all similarly equipped. Check in was friendly and efficient and our luggage was swiftly conveyed to our 10th floor suite. The suite was as expected, clean and comfortable with a good view from the top floor. Unfortunately the maid had missed the half eaten sandwich and half empty ( or is it half full ?) bottle of vodka in the fridge but no matter. The suite was equipped with a lounge having a small kitchenette having a sink,coffee maker, fridge and micro wave. There is tv in the lounge and bedroom and a good sized bathroom. The windows do an excellent job of shutting out traffic/airport noise though the aircon is rather noisy.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was variable and others have commented,it can be cold and unpalatable. Dinner service that evening was also a bit on the slow side though things improved by lunch time next day when it had become rather more efficient.
reviews.title: Great Night's Sleep

likes.liked: — A great bed and breakfast included in the price

reviews.text: The hotel lobby area has what they call a business room. Its just a room with two pc's having internet access. A couple more would have been usefull. The fitness room and pool are good though.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay...

reviews.text: I was very happy with this hotel. I really wanted to stay in the tourist area of Boston, but found the rates outragous. So I ended up here because of the convenience of the location near the airport and car rental agencies.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Although there is absolutly nothing to see in the area around the hotel, the excellent shuttle service made up for it. The shuttle operates 24 hours per day, and will take you to the very nice and uncrowded airport subway station. From there the subway will take you to the Faneuil Hall area in 5 minutes. Altogether the shuttle/train ride took about 15 minutes. When you get back to the airport subway station, just give the hotel a call and the shutlle will pick you up (remember to bring that phone number!)
reviews.title: Convenient airport hotel, great rooms, clean and quiet

likes.liked: — Excellent location for car rental pick-up/return and getaway to airport

reviews.text: The rooms were very nice and spacious.
reviews.title: I've been at better embassy's

reviews.text: The free breakfast included hot items such as eggs and bacon. If you don't want what is served buffett style, you can order an omlett or other items.
reviews.title: Rooms only at this Embassy Suites

likes.disliked: — Although close to the airport its otherwise a terrible location

reviews.text: Try not to order lunch or dinner there, they were ok but not great. Much better to go into Boston proper where you can eat like a king and pay less too. (I recommend the pubs).
reviews.title: We loved this hotel! Very clean and friendly hotel!

likes.disliked: — No restaurants in the area other than the hotel restaurant

reviews.text: Ironically, I am writing this review from the Business Center of the Embassy Suites Boston Logan--the hotel I am reviewing. I want to say up front that my review is *relative* to the many other Embassy Suites I have previously stayed in. My wife is HHonors Gold status and we stay in many Hilton properties including Embassy Suites.
reviews.title: Very Disappointed

reviews.text: The negative review I am about to give is the result of the fact that this Embassy Suites is extremely run-down looking compared to all other Embassy Suites in which I've stayed and the staff is much more clueless than those encountered at other Embassy Suites properties. I don't know the history of this property but I suspect it has been converted (poorly in my opinion) from a different hotel chain.
reviews.title: worst embassy suite ever

likes.disliked: — seemed in poor repair, staff poorly trained

reviews.text: The staff here, with the exception of the shuttle driver who picked us up promptly from the airport, has been nearly clueless. We arrived at 1:30 to check in and, as we expected, our room was not yet ready. No problem, as we wanted to get some lunch anyway, so we asked about having them hold our luggage. "No problem," I was told and "Please go wait over there by the concierge desk". So we wait, and wait, and wait, all the time in the full view of the front desk and the lady there who had told us where to wait.
reviews.title: Hotel Overbooks! They relocated us to out-of-the-way motel instead.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After about 10 minutes I go back over and ask if we are going to be able to check out bags some time today (actually I asked very nicely), and she acts very surprised that we were still waiting. Hey lady, we've been standing right in your full view while you weren't doing anything for 10 minutes--why would you be surprised? So we finally get someone to help us check our luggage and I then I go back to the front desk lady and ask her for directions to some nearby food and she recommends we walk down Cottage St. to Chelsea where there is a very good pizza place. Great. However after walking probably 3/4 miles (with a 9 and 13 year old) all the way to the end of Cottage we find it never intersects with Chelsea and that you have to walk over a few blocks. Gee thanks for the great directions lady.
reviews.title: decent experience but not typical Embassy Suites

likes.disliked: — Location to subway stop and disorganized breakfast buffet

reviews.text: Strike number two.
reviews.title: Not your typical Embassy Suite

aka: Embassy Suites Boston Logan Airport Hotel Boston
